newsitem.title: USA: Blyth announces several executive changes.
newsitem.headline: Blyth announces several executive changes.

text.p: Blyth Holdings Inc said Tim Negris was named president and chief executive officer in a series of executive changes announced Wednesday.
Negris, who was previously executive vice president of marketing and development, replaces Michael Minor, who resigned as chairman and chief executive officer.
However, Blyth said Minor remains a strategic advisor to the company.
The company also said Stephen Lorentzen resigned as president and chief operating officer, and Richard Hanchen returned to the position of chairman.
The company said Negris is in charge of "leading the reinvention of Blyth and the restructuring of (its) OMNIS product line."
